DataElement.preferredName: Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care 18 During Hospital or Clinic Visits after Abnormal Screening or Diagnosis Regular Doctor was Informed About the Results of Test Agreement Score Agreement 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated agreement about whether their regular doctor was informed about the results of the test they got during hospital or clinical visits after receiving abnormal screening or diagnosis, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care Questionnaire During Hospital or Clinic Visits after Abnormal Screening or Diagnosis Regular Doctor was Informed About the Results of Test Agreement Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed measure patient satisfaction with cancer care. It is designed to address: 1) satisfaction with care during screening and treatment, 2) challenges of poor and minority individuals receiving cancer-related care, and 3) relevance for evaluation of care for both navigated and un-navigated patients. The questionnaire is usually administered within 3 months of screening and again 3 months after the initiation of treatment._The time period during a hospital or clinic visit and after when an individual received an abnormal screening or diagnosis._A response indicating that an individual feels or felt that their regular doctor was informed about the results of the test they got._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 5 (Strongly Agree) on a 5-point Likert scale._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PSCC (Patient Satisfaction with Cancer Care Questionnaire)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: My regular doctor was informe
